Question: What is the name of your wireless network modernization project?
Guidance: Provide internal project reference name

Question: Who is the primary stakeholder for this Wi-Fi infrastructure project?
Guidance: Name, role, and decision-making authority
Notes: Main point of contact and decision authority

Question: What wireless connectivity challenges are driving this network upgrade?
Guidance: Common challenges: Poor WiFi coverage, Slow performance, No visibility, Manual troubleshooting, Capacity constraints, Guest access complexity
Notes: Primary business driver for wireless modernization

Question: What is your current wireless infrastructure?
Guidance: Describe current vendor/model, controller type, AP count, and limitations

Question: What are the most common Wi-Fi issues your users experience?
Guidance: Common issues: Slow speeds, Dropped connections, Dead zones, Roaming problems, Guest access difficulties

Question: What are your primary goals for wireless network modernization?
Guidance: Common goals: Improve coverage, Increase speed, Simplify management, Enable location services, Reduce troubleshooting time, Support growth

Question: How will you measure wireless network success?
Guidance: Define KPIs: uptime %, user satisfaction, helpdesk ticket reduction, troubleshooting time, coverage improvements

Question: What is your expected timeline for Wi-Fi deployment?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 0-3 months, 3-6 months, 6-12 months, 12+ months

Question: What is your approved budget range for wireless infrastructure?
Guidance: Common ranges: $50K-100K, $100K-300K, $300K-1M, $1M+. Include hardware software and services

Question: What is your long-term vision for network infrastructure?
Guidance: Consider AI-driven operations, location analytics, IoT integration, automation

Question: How do you expect wireless device counts to change over 3 years?
Guidance: Provide current device count and projected annual growth rate

Question: What is the size and type of your facility?
Guidance: Describe square footage, building materials, floor count, facility type (office, campus, warehouse)
Notes: RF coverage planning and AP density

Question: How many buildings or locations need wireless coverage?
Guidance: Count separate buildings, floors, and remote locations

Question: What areas require wireless coverage?
Guidance: Specify: Office spaces, Conference rooms, Common areas, Outdoor areas, Warehouses, Parking lots
Notes: Coverage area mapping and AP placement

Question: How many concurrent wireless users do you need to support?
What types of devices connect to your wireless network?
Guidance: Devices: Laptops, Smartphones, Tablets, IoT sensors, Printers, VoIP phones, Medical devices

Question: What throughput and bandwidth do you require?
Guidance: Specify: Per-user bandwidth, Application requirements, Download/upload speeds

Question: What Wi-Fi standards do you need to support?
Guidance: Standards: Wi-Fi 6 (802.11ax), Wi-Fi 6E (6 GHz), Wi-Fi 7 future-proofing

Question: Do you need 6 GHz support (Wi-Fi 6E)?
Guidance: Benefits: More spectrum, Less interference, Higher throughput, Future-proofing

Question: What is your preferred wireless architecture?
Guidance: Options: Cloud-managed (Mist), On-premises controller, Hybrid approach

Question: Do you need wired network infrastructure upgrades?
Guidance: Consider: PoE switches, Switch port capacity, Uplink bandwidth, Network segmentation

Question: What routing and switching infrastructure exists?
Guidance: Describe: Core switches, Distribution switches, VLANs, Routing protocols

Question: How many SSIDs and VLANs do you need?
Guidance: Common VLANs: Corporate, Guest, IoT, Voice, Management

Question: Do you need seamless roaming across APs?
Guidance: Use cases: VoIP calls, Video streaming, Real-time applications, Large facilities

Question: What guest Wi-Fi capabilities do you need?
Guidance: Features: Captive portal, Social login, Vouchers, Sponsored access, Self-registration

Question: What authentication methods are required?
Guidance: Methods: 802.1X (RADIUS), WPA2/WPA3 Enterprise, Certificate-based, PSK, Open with portal

Question: Do you have IoT devices requiring wireless connectivity?
Guidance: Common IoT: Sensors, Cameras, Building automation, Medical devices, Asset tracking

Question: Do you need indoor location tracking?
Guidance: Use cases: Wayfinding, Asset tracking, People counting, Occupancy analytics, Contact tracing

Question: What wireless analytics capabilities do you need?
Guidance: Analytics: User engagement, Application usage, Presence analytics, Heatmaps, Dwell time

Question: What wireless security standards must you meet?
Guidance: Standards: WPA2, WPA3, 802.1X, MAC filtering, Rogue AP detection

Question: Do you need wireless network segmentation?
Guidance: Segmentation: Guest isolation, IoT isolation, Corporate separation, Role-based access

Question: What compliance frameworks must the wireless network support?
Guidance: Common standards: PCI DSS, HIPAA, SOC 2, ISO 27001, NIST, FedRAMP

Question: Do you need rogue AP and client detection?
Guidance: Capabilities: Wireless intrusion detection, Rogue AP containment, Client isolation

Question: What encryption requirements apply?
Guidance: Requirements: WPA3 (AES-256), 802.1X with EAP-TLS, Certificate management

Question: What access control policies are required?
Guidance: Policies: Role-based access, Time-based access, Location-based access, Device posture

Question: What data privacy requirements do you have?
Guidance: Privacy: User tracking consent, Data retention policies, GDPR compliance, Anonymization

Question: What uptime requirements do you have for wireless services?
What support coverage do you require?
Guidance: Options: Business hours (8x5), Extended (24x5), Full (24x7)

Question: How do you currently troubleshoot wireless issues?
Guidance: Current process: Packet captures, AP logs, Controller diagnostics, User reports, Site visits

Question: What monitoring and alerting is required?
Guidance: Requirements: Uptime metrics, Performance dashboards, Anomaly alerts, Client experience scores

Question: What is your process for wireless configuration changes?
Guidance: Describe: Change windows, Approval process, Testing requirements, Rollback procedures

Question: Do you need integration with helpdesk/ITSM systems?
Guidance: Systems: ServiceNow, Jira Service Desk, Zendesk, Email ticketing

Question: What documentation do you require?
Guidance: Types: As-built RF maps, AP placement diagrams, Configuration guides, Troubleshooting runbooks

Question: Are you interested in AI-driven network troubleshooting?
Guidance: Marvis capabilities: Conversational AI, Proactive anomaly detection, Root cause analysis, Self-healing

Question: What network operations tasks consume the most time?
Guidance: Common tasks: Troubleshooting, RF optimization, Configuration changes, Client diagnostics, Capacity planning
Notes: AIOps value proposition and use cases

Question: Do you want predictive network insights?
Guidance: Insights: Anomaly detection before user impact, Capacity forecasting, Performance trends, Client experience prediction

Question: What network tasks would you like to automate?
Guidance: Tasks: RF optimization, Channel selection, Power adjustment, Client steering, Configuration deployment

Question: How do you measure wireless user experience today?
Guidance: Current metrics: Speed tests, Helpdesk tickets, User surveys, AP uptime, Coverage maps

Question: What Service Level Expectations (SLEs) matter most?
Guidance: SLEs: Successful connects, Time to connect, Throughput, Roaming, Capacity

Question: Who will be the technical lead for this wireless project?
Guidance: Name, role, contact information

Question: What internal resources are available for wireless deployment?
Guidance: List team members, roles, and time commitment (hours per week)
Notes: Resource planning and project timeline feasibility

Question: What is your team's experience with Mist/Juniper wireless?
Guidance: Experience levels: No experience, Basic knowledge, Intermediate, Advanced, Expert
Notes: Training needs assessment and knowledge transfer

Question: What is your preferred deployment approach?
Guidance: Options: Phased by building/floor, Pilot then rollout, Big bang replacement, Parallel run with cutover

Question: Do you need a professional RF site survey?
Guidance: Survey types: Predictive (design), Pre-deployment (validation), Post-deployment (verification)
Notes: Site survey requirements and AP placement

Question: What cabling infrastructure exists for APs?
Guidance: Describe: Cat6/Cat6a, PoE capacity, Drop ceiling access, Plenum requirements

Question: What PoE switch infrastructure do you have?
Guidance: PoE standards: 802.3af (15.4W), 802.3at (25.5W), 802.3bt (60-90W for Wi-Fi 6E)

Question: What is your preferred AP cutover strategy?
Guidance: Options: Off-hours replacement, Weekend deployment, Staged building-by-building, Zero-downtime overlap

Question: What testing approach do you require?
Guidance: Types: RF validation, Client connectivity, Roaming, Application performance, Throughput validation

Question: What training will be needed for IT staff?
Guidance: Types: Mist dashboard training, Marvis AI usage, Troubleshooting, RF fundamentals, Best practices

Question: What are your main concerns about wireless infrastructure migration?
Guidance: Consider: Downtime risk, Coverage gaps, Performance issues, Budget overruns, Timeline delays
Notes: Primary implementation concerns and risk factors

Question: What could cause this wireless project to fail?
Guidance: Consider: Poor RF planning, Inadequate testing, Resource constraints, User resistance, Integration issues
Notes: Failure mode analysis and mitigation planning

Question: What are your concerns about achieving complete coverage?
Guidance: Consider: Building materials, Outdoor areas, Interference sources, Legacy client support

Question: What performance risks worry you most?
Guidance: Consider: User density, High-bandwidth applications, IoT device volume, Interference, Capacity limits

Question: What external dependencies exist for this project?
Guidance: Examples: Cabling contractors, Electricians, PoE switch procurement, Building access approvals
Notes: Project dependencies and critical path items

Question: What constraints must the solution work within?
Guidance: Consider: Budget limits, Timeline, Building restrictions, Aesthetic requirements, IT policies
